intro: Richardsiella, commonly known as the "cushion plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing rosette structure, often forming dense mats of foliage. The leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments. Richardsiella species produce small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. These plants are primarily found in rocky or sandy soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
